channel.title: How to run a client without CMD(Command Prompt box)
channel.description:
Hello guys, this is more of a copy&paste tutorial, you will have just to change a few things in ur run.bat/load.bat or what ever batch file you got to run your client. Ok, right click on your batch file, and click edit - [img]http://img237.imageshack.us/img237/9396/editrightclick.png[/img] [u][b]Note[/b][/u] : You might not have Xmx500m, you might have an other number, so you do not have to change it! Ok so, it shoulda look like this :
@echo off java -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui pause
So you gotta change that it runs as javaw, and that it closes after its loaded. [code]@echo off Start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui exit[/code] This is what you actually changed :
java -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
to [code]Start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui[/code] and :
pause
to [code]exit[/code] Please move this thread if I posted in the wrong section! Thanks.

item.title: How to run a client without CMD(Command Prompt box)
item.dc:creator: @I_Roll_Deep I Roll Deep
item.description:
@I_Roll_Deep wrote:

[quote=“Javafire, post:30, topic:354330”]lol and you can add a cls over pause to erase everything the client says prior to the client loading, wtf is the deal cmd commands aren’t exactly code, and sure as hell aren’t hard.[/quote] Haven`t thinked about it, sorry

Read full topic
item.source: How to run a client without CMD(Command Prompt box)

item.title: How to run a client without CMD(Command Prompt box)
item.dc:creator: @I_Roll_Deep I Roll Deep
item.description:
@I_Roll_Deep wrote:

[quote=“Humblerr, post:26, topic:354330”]and what how does this work for client windows 7?:

@echo off
title pk server
“C:/Program files (x86)/java/jre6/bin/java.exe” -Xmx500m client 0 0 highmem members 0
pause[/quote]
On Windows 7 if you want working clients you have to download a windows 7 convertor, which can be found on MoparScape forums.

Read full topic
item.source: How to run a client without CMD(Command Prompt box)

item.title: How to run a client without CMD(Command Prompt box)
item.dc:creator: @RSCLives RSCLives
item.description:
@RSCLives wrote:

OR you could take out start and it’ll work…

And if you are sure you have JDK/JRE installed and it says java isnt right… Either A. (easy-hard way) Set your environmental paths… or B. Use this which I found extremely helpful…

"C:/Program files/java/jdk1.6.0_21/bin/java.exe" or where-ever you have it

Read full topic

and what how does this work for client windows 7?:

title pk server
“C:/Program files (x86)/java/jre6/bin/java.exe” -Xmx500m client 0 0 highmem members 0
pause

item.title: How to run a client without CMD(Command Prompt box)
item.dc:creator: @I_Roll_Deep I Roll Deep
item.description:
@I_Roll_Deep wrote:

[quote=“Jingojohn, post:21, topic:354330”]And btw, is it fine if I put your tutorial in my client and give you credits?
Here is what I have changed:
[i]
Tutorial Credits: I Roll Deep

Hello guys, this is a copy and paste tutorial. You will have just to change a few things in your run.bat or whatever batch file you have to run your client.

Right click on your batch file, and click edit -

Note : You might not have Xmx500m, you might have an other number, so you do not have to change it!

Ok so, it should look like this :

@echo off
java -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
pause

You have to change that it runs as javaw, and that it closes after its loaded.

@echo off
Start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
exit

This is what you actually changed :
“java -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui” to “Start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui” and change pause to exit [/quote]

Sure, just gimme credits

Read full topic
item.source: How to run a client without CMD(Command Prompt box)

item.title: How to run a client without CMD(Command Prompt box)
item.dc:creator: @Jingojohn Jingojohn
item.description:
@Jingojohn wrote:

And btw, is it fine if I put your tutorial in my client and give you credits?
Here is what I have changed:
[i]
Tutorial Credits: I Roll Deep

Hello guys, this is a copy and paste tutorial. You will have just to change a few things in your run.bat or whatever batch file you have to run your client.

Right click on your batch file, and click edit -

Note : You might not have Xmx500m, you might have an other number, so you do not have to change it!

Ok so, it should look like this :

@echo off
java -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
pause

You have to change that it runs as javaw, and that it closes after its loaded.

@echo off
Start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
exit

This is what you actually changed :
“java -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui” to “Start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui” and change pause to exit

Read full topic
item.source: How to run a client without CMD(Command Prompt box)

[/quote] You see if you got errors when you compile mostly, not while you are running your client o_O

no i meen…like a thread4 error or something…not all errors come up when you compile[/quote]
